meanings.definition: To pay out money, especially from a fund or account.
meanings.sent1: I will disburse the allowance to my children every week.
meanings.sent2: The company will disburse the salaries to employees at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank decided to disburse its savings to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to disburse coins of rain across the fields.
meanings.sent5: She carefully disbursted the coins into the vending machine.

meanings.sent1: The wind will disburse the seeds across the garden.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will disburse the worksheets to the students.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to disburse the nuts all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to disburse joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand appeared to disburse sparks of light in all directions.
